reviews.review_text: Exceeding expectations - simply put, this restaurant is a bar raiser. Absolutely incredible food, service and atmosphere and should be the example for what all restaurants in this price range (or higher) should aim for. The tasting menu is a steal at $85 pp. We left satisfied and full to the brim!

Come with good company for the best evening possible!   Down to earth but superb  table service. The food is amazing here.  The wine was great. The service lovely.  Come by with friends where the food will definitely be as good if not better than the company and conversation. I loved the vibe is family style and inviting, doesnt pretend to be super fancy where you can be comfortable to be you and still enjoy the flavours as it was meant. Thank you for a memorable meal..I will definitely be back soon.

Walk in without reservation. The place was not too busy at the beginning I guess because was a raining night . We chose sitting at the bar. The restaurant later got very busy .Atmosphere was cozy and with good vibe. Our server Blanka was friendly and attentive . We ordered the testing menu and it blew our mind .  The testing menu is speically made for each table. Service asked a few questions and selected a special menu by the chef. Food was delicious and we enjoyed it so much . The price was reasonable. We definitely will come back again and high recommended.

Was here for aspecial birthday, and the food here was incredibly tasty. Drinks were also very refreshing. The atmosphere here is unrivaled with the decor and beautifully plated dishes constantly moving across from the kitchen to tables. I love how everything here is designed to be shared - such a wonderful dining experience.

The food was incredible! It was our first time and we got the tasting menu and WOW! It was delicious! We didn t expect to get fried fish at all and I m so happy we did. It made the experience so unique and the fish was fried perfectly and tasted so delightful. At first I thought the pasta was pretty plain but it had great flavour! Definitely recommend the fish though I was glad we got that over a steak since steaks are so common at many tasting menus. Thank you for a great first time experience! Sorry my photos are terrible and I didn t get a photo of the appy and dessert.

I reserved a single seat at the bar reservation for 5:00 p.m.  I was quite fortunate to be given a seat on the patio because the restaurant wasnt that busy; it was a serene and beautiful setting!  Along with passing out the standard menus, the waitress read out the days specials. I selected the lemony tortellini from the normal menu, along with the featured arugula salad.  I also had a glass of water for starters.  Together, the food was delicious, and the serving sizes were perfect.  Additionally, the waitress was cordial, attentive, and made sure my service experience was excellent. I had a wonderful, exceptional eating experience, which much improved my evening after a difficult birthday night the day before.  Id love to revisit Savio Volpe to try their Alla Famiglia and/or their green spaghetti sometime. Vegetarian options: My chosen menu items happened to be vegetarian.

Can t say enough wonderful things about this place. Recently had an anniversary dinner and it was just spectacular. The feature pasta dish was cooked perfectly and the flavours always poppin. A note here: even though we asked for no seafood/fish they accidentally brought us a vegetable dish with fish but they quickly remedied it by bringing us a different vegetable which was SO GOOD. (dragon tongue beans with prosciutto crumble, picture below) PLUS they gave us a complimentary little dessert which was a delight and of course all anniversaries get a little flute of bubbly! Honestly, even though they re a family of restaurants and cafes, I think this one is truly the favourite for me!

What a great experience!!! We went there for my birthday    and it was excellent Simon, our server, is a master in hospitality. He was so kind and definitely made our evening. Thank you very much for that! The food was super delicious. You have to try the garlic bread!!! Great flavors and everything was beyond our expectations! Highly recommendable!

A wonderful dining experience with delicious food, great service and a buzzing atmosphere. We did the family style menu which was picked by the chefs based on a few questions. It was perfect and so much food; plenty of value. We celebrated a birthday and we had a complimentary glass of champagne ready for us when we arrived plus a cute birthday dessert. Highly recommend.

Service was spectacular - everyone was very friendly and our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave great recommendations. The quality of the ingredients was top notch and the fresh pasta was perfection. We were celebrating a birthday and they gave a free dessert and Prosecco which was a very nice touch. I will say, the dessert menu feels like a bit of an afterthought. With how great the food is, I d love to see some delicious desserts! Overall, very excited to come back.

One of the best spots in town for us! Everything is delicious from starters to salads, pastas to proteins! Would highly recommend the custom set menu and let your waiter know what you re feeling that night!

Got the option to have items chosen for our family and it was more than worth it, and much better than picking individual items. Recieved way more food than we expected and everything was great. Service was excellent. The pork and polenta were definitely the highlights. We also all loved our server and randomly shared dog photos with him.

This is my second visit to this restaurant, the service was magnificent, our server was attentive and entertaining. The atmosphere this time was somehow so much better than my first visit, the food was excellent. We had beef, it was delicious. We also love the rhubarb strawberry tart, it was the best!

We chose this restaurant, Osteria Savio Volpe , for our anniversary celebration and were absolutely delighted with our choice..from the moment we entered , the staff were very present in a warm and friendly manner..the menu was amazing and our choice of the  Alla Famiglia  was perfect as we wanted a shared experience.. each course was unique and different.. the restaurant features a rustic Italian kitchen tradition which focuses on local ingredients the conversations of the customers at the tables surrounding us proved that the dining experience was special and promoted lively conversations and praise for the wood-fired grill that provided such fresh and tasty dishes..again the staff deserve applause for their warm and helpful hospitality Vegetarian options: there were many items available on the menu.. Parking: free parking along community streets and paid parking very near the restaurant.. Wheelchair accessibility: from the sidewalk the restaurant entrance is present for easy entry..
One of my favorite restaurant in town. Pasta dishes are always perfect, the Ragu stood out this time round. The Chicken Liver mousse crostini was delicious! Must reserve table ahead.

We made a reservation here for our 3 year anniversary and our waiter, Simon, was an amazing kind host and so helpful! We ordered the chef selection set menu and it was really cool how we could tell them what we preferred to eat (eg. preference for chicken over beef, more cheesy dishes, etc). Every dish we had was pretty top tier delicious. My absolute favourite was the burrata appetizer - so creamy and truly a cheese lover s dream! Only issue we had was the tables were too close to other tables and it felt like 2 other parties were sitting with us on our date lol. It didn t feel very private and was kind of crammed in that way. Otherwise, thanks for the amazing hospitality

Simon! Totally made our night special for a birthday celebration. On top of the great meal we had, Simon went out of his way to provide exceptional service the entire night. Been here a few times before and food is always consistent, but make sure you make reservations in advance. Get the focaccia and the garlic bread - you won t regret it. We ll definitely be back.

My family and I are from out of town and booked our table a few months in advance. We had heard it was amazing and it 100% lived up to the hype. We did the tasting menu for our table of 4. The food just kept coming! We were shocked to have so much food continuously come to the table. It was my first time trying a few of them items served and they exceeded expectations. For $79 you definitely get your bang for buck and a wonderful experience! The wait staff was also fantastic. As soon as you took a sip of water, someone was there to refill it. Cleared and wiped tables between courses too! We will be back!

Had the tasting menu on October 25th Highlight was the gnocchi, but everything was delicious. Spiritually I cannot give less than 5 stars for food if I feel the food is really a 4.5, steelhead dish had a crispy skin that was more over-charred but the flesh was tender and perfect. The burratta and blueberry dish and the beet salad with oranges were both excellent starters and we scarfed them down. The Massimo negroni I had was fantastic, vegan amaretto sour was alright but maybe ask if they have real ones instead next time, something about the texture and flavour compared to a regular one left something to be desired. Yeehaw for vegans though.

Went on a friends recommendation and to celebrate my brothers birthday. The food was amazing! The prosciutto and garlic bread were so yummy. The seasonal pork belly was tender and the ribeye was cooked perfectly. The agnolotti was beautifully al dente and the lavender limoncello sherbet was perfectly sour with the right amount of lavender. Would definitely come here again to try more dishes! The service was also amazing and so attentive.

It s was our first time to experience dinning in Savio Volpe. It truly was an amazing experience. We were there to celebrate a friends birthday. The ambiance was excellent as we felt welcomed. Throughout our dinning experience it almost felt like we re having a 5 star dinner at home as we felt very comfortable enjoying all the amazing food and savouring each dish. The flavours were amazing. I m so happy to say that each dish we had was so pleasing to the palate. That we all had to sigh and moan lol while eating each dish. We ordered the family style  Alla Famiglia  and there s 5 of us to share and truly enjoyed this experience. Our server Rob was excellent as he always checked how we re doing and very knowledgeable about each dish. I highly recommend to go ahead and try it out to truly experience something spectacular.

All round incredible dining experience! The staff were super attentive and friendly, the food was out of this world, especially the Ribeye. It was our anniversary and we were giving a complimentary glass of frizzante. Cannot wait to go again!

Came here for dinner. Tuna crudo was light and refreshing. Portions for main dishes were large which is always appreciated. The pork chop was moist and seasoned well, I was pleasantly surprised when it came with 2 pork chops! The oxtail pasta was flavourful and the meat was tender. Drinks were good as well.

Theres a reason that this restaurant has a wait list for months because everything we had was absolutely fantastic.  The food was so flavourful, original and beautifully presented.  Price was perfect for what you get.  The staff were absolutely fantastic and had a great sense of humor.  We went with the Dine Alla Famiglia where you let the restaurant decide your menu for you and it was so worth it.  Every dish was so delicious and it just kept getting better and better.  Highly recommend the kale salad and the Spaghetti and pea tip pistou, they were awesome.  They also had a special gnocchi dish thats not on the menu and it was packed with flavour.  Hopefully itll end up being on the menu because we couldnt get enough of it. Will definitely be back, its worth the wait.

A bit far from the center but worth it! Excellent quality of the product and the service is experienced and attentive. 10/10!!! We had a burrata as a starter, the kale salad and then we split a pasta that the chef recommended us!

The food was delicious, it was the second time we went and we were surprised again, the best restaurant weve ever been to here in Canada. We were treated very well by Nathan, you have a great waiter, cheerful and good humored, it certainly made a difference in our experience.

This popular Italian theme restaurant located in east Vancouver on Kingsway, parking is basically on the street, lucky after 6pm you can park without issues, food quality is good, tasty and unpretentious, not your normal   parlor but more earth tone dishes, i like this type of cooking, i recommend to try the garlic pull bread, the thick noodles with tomato sauce, chicken liver pate with sourdough,the pork chop which is juicy and delicious, highly recommended. The server is knowledgeable and friendly, reservation is required because they only open for dinner. The table for six is kind of tight, otherwise everything is great. Will return. Recommended

We did alla famiglia and let the Chefs do the cooking for us and it was fantastic. Service and atmosphere was exquisite and was a unique dining experience. With every dish came the curiosity of what was next and whether it was the end. Excellently presented and fulfilling with a wonderful dessert at the end. Very sophisticated and complimenting cocktails to enhance our dining experience along with fine wines.
The tasting menu is the way to go! From appetizers to dessert, you get over a dozen different dishes punctuated with great in house gelato. Best part of all is the awesome service! Must try!
Amazing atmosphere, waiter and food. Hostess could do better job. Everything from appetizer, salad, pasta to protein was awesome. Even the dessert Food : 5/5

Great atmosphere, very busy but still feels good and friendly. The food was excellent and seems to be coming out of a Italian mama kitchen. Sergio, our server, was amazing and just so friendly while being genuine, he made the experience even greater. Food

I celebrated my birthday at Savio Volpe and it was an excellent experience. I received a birthday card with their in-house salad recipe, and really enjoyed everything from the appetizers to the dessert. The staff were welcoming and checked in on us throughout our meal. Make sure you make reservations as this place is very popular!

Osteria Savio Volpe provided an unforgettable dining experience for my birthday celebration. The cocktails, including martinis, Negronis, and gin and tonics, were expertly crafted and heightened our anticipation for the meal. The Insalata Salads were refreshing, and the Hawaiian kanpachi crudo, marinated fennel, calamansi, jalapeno stood out with its delicate flavors and perfect balance. The presentation of the dishes was impeccable, reflecting the restaurants commitment to both taste and aesthetics. The ambiance, with warm lighting and rustic decor, added to the overall experience. Great dining experience that combines traditional Italian flavors with modern culinary innovation.

My partner and I came here for date night.  What a spectacular place even though its not a romantic atmosphere the vibe and interior of this place is amazing.  Our waitress Vanessa was awesome from her greet and all through our meal she was always there to explain and answer our questions. We had the let us cook for you and everything was spectacular.  Stephen who brought us wine was very informative as well and a great sense of humor.  Hats off to all the staff here you should be proud of what you all accomplish.
Food was good however as a person who s been here year after year, I can say that the pasta portions have gotten smaller and smaller

Outstanding food and service. Portions were perfect and we left feeling so satisfied. Every bite was a flavour explosion. The decor is pleasant but even on a rainy Wednesday night it was packed and loud. We were squeezed into a table which was too close to other dinners but I understand they are trying meet the demand

Went here for a birthday dinner and it exceeded our expectations! We went with  alla famiglia  style which was a 4-course meal and got our server s recommendations. Some very interesting dishes but love the complex flavours. It was very filling for the two of us. They also gave a special birthday treat at the end. Highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion! Also big shout-out to our server who was super sweet!

WANT A GOOD TIME? COME HERE! Firstly, absolutely delicious food, everything was so good. I took my girlfriend out here for a very special occasion and they made us feel at home and took care of us like no other restaurant has. We came in early for our reso but they still accommodated us at the bar while they set up the perfect booth. Everyone was taking care of our time so well,  we were able to just enjoy the food and each others company :)

My husband and I came for our 5 year anniversary dinner. The dining atmosphere was exceptionally intimate and the front of house staff were always prepared, anticipating our needs. Our server, Simon, was so friendly and considerate of our dietary needs as halal/pescatarians and he quickly simplified the menu for us so it was much easier to understand the items and decide what we liked. The Bagna cauda was hot and delicious and we also noticed the servers carefully crafting the times of the upcoming dishes to enhance the dining experience. We always enjoy trying the new seasonal pasta fresca and the preseved lemon tortelloni had alot of new creamy flavors for our pallets. The dishes at Savio Volpe are fairly inclusive and next time wed like to dive into more of the fish/seafood options instead of staying strictly vegetarian. We are definitely coming back in the upcoming weeks to explore the dessert menu and just want to congratulate management/staff for running this efficient and delicious restaurant that we are excited to return to again. Sincerely Ami & Scott
Came here for a birthday celebration. Got the 5 course tasting menu. All the dishes were very unique and flavourful.

Went to celebrate a birthday and it was a wonderful experience. The food was absolutely delicious! Our server gave us great recommendations to balance out our meal. Ambience was wonderful, it can be a bit loud so probably not ideal for long conversations but overall, still a great atmosphere to be in! Would definitely recommend as every single dish we had was flavourful and cooked well!

Food flavours and presentation were incredible! Servers were exceptional! Definitely made my wifes birthday a memorable experience. Would have ordered more of the menu if I wasnt so full. Servings were healthy. Very nice decor and atmosphere. Will come again for sure. Possibly best meal out all year!

Absolutely phenomenal food. We ate family style which included 12 dishes for $85 and it was easily worth the price. Every dish was more delicious than the last. Not a single bad dish in the bunch. Couldnt recommend more!
Lots of options for vegetarians and meat lovers alike. Always amazing value whether a la carte or doing the set table menus. Cannot go wrong! Everything is delicious and well priced.

We decided to do the chefs choice menu. So for $79 a person, all the food is brought out share style and you dont know whats coming. It was a great choice and everything was amazing. There was lots of food for 3 people, everything tasted delicious and it was really fun not know what would come next. The service was great and well be back for sure.

We visited here to celebrate our engagement an this was hands down the best meal my partner and I have ever shared together. We both opted for the Let Us Cook for You meal and were absolutely blown away by how unique and perfectly curated the experience was. Every single course was an explosion of different flavors and thing we never would have thought to order for ourselves but were so thrilled they were served to us. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of our meal and both agreed that though the price is on the higher end it actually felt like an excellent value for the quality and quantity of what we were served. I look forward to the day I can dine at this restaurant again!

Service was excellent and food was very tasty. We ordered the Alla Famiglia, 5 courses meal by the chefs choices. Food was tasty and portion size was generous. Two of us could not finish all. I was basically full by 3rd course. The dessert chocolate pie was not my favorite, but the server gave us another dessert, lemon meringue ice cream, it was sweet and sour, great balance. We would definitely come back again.
This place is amazing! Everything was well presented and delicious. The service was outstanding! I will be back here. Thank you for the great experience!!

Celebrated my partners birthday here. Sat at the bar, lovely ambience. We went for the family style chefs choice options and were blown away. Our server Ryan was absolutely amazing and made great suggestions. Thank you for a memorable evening.

It was first time for our family there and it was interesting experience. Let s start from outside where parking is not that difficult as street parking is available. You should reserve your table in advance which may be weeks in advance especially if you re more than two. I also noticed couples who find a place without booking it. Seating area is so nice with nice atmosphere. But if you re not that slim, you may feel tight seating space. Waitresses are helpful and many will help to serve you. As it was our first time we order familia order where they choose food for you and you can order it for 4 or 5 persons and food will be enough. It was so nice to have some plates that you don t know what are they. Once a plate is added , they explain to you the content and what they call it. Then you start share it together. Family order consist of 2 appetisers, 2 salads, 2 different pastas, 2 main dishes, 2 sides, and two deserts. All are tasting nice and the whole experience was great.

I really liked the decor of the restaurant and the service from the staff was superb. However, the place does get very busy. It becomes quite crowded and noisy as we eat. But that is understandable as the food here is not bad and the prices are expensive, but still within reason for decent Italian food. The appetizer and sides were delicious, I absolutely loved the way that the asparagus was cooked and seasoned, while the appetizer we got was really good, the only suggestion I have for that is to make the croutons softer and it would be a perfect dish. The entrees were quite flavourful and the textures of the meat and noodles were perfect, my main complaint I have is that both of those dishes were too salty. Although, I really appreciated the server addressed and remedied the issue for us. The roasted strawberry gelato was absolutely fantastic and I would definitely recommend it. Overall, this was a nice restaurant and I would revisit.

Reservations a must, tables booked days in advance  however last minute cancellations do occur. First thing that hits you when you walk in is the noise level, extremely loud, almost as if everyone is yelling at the top of their lungs. Consistent noise decibels cant be good for your hearing. The second smack in the face is that the seating arrangements are almost on top of each other, wouldnt recommend a romantic evening unless its just for the food. Waiter was prompt, explaining all the off menu specials, alot to digest before making a decision. Very willing to answer any questions on the menu items. Started off with the prosciutto appetizer and endive anchovy salad.  The presentation were both works of art and top quality ingredients blended to create a distinct flavor profile.  Prosciutto and anchovies were fresh and extremely flavorful. Main dishes, pappardalle w/ oxtail and the features deboned rainbow trout. Pappardalle was al dente Rainbow trout was cooked perfectly, texture and taste superb well complimented with the lemon butter, parsley, etc Ended with a nice cannoli for dessert Although the atmosphere was not to my personal preference, the food made up for it.

We selected the chefs choice 5 course meal. Our server (Blanca, who was fantastic) inquired about our likes and dislikes and then went off to the kitchen. Every course was a surprise, and each one did not disappoint. All five courses were SPECTACULAR. Like truly 5-star amazing. The portions were generous... Our waistbands were popping by the time the 4th course arrived. But we couldnt help but continue our meal, it was all so delicious. Would highly recommend the chefs choice ($75pp) as it was a great value and was fun to guess what might come out next (all dishes were from the menu). The wine was also excellent, and even though we were stuffed, ordered espresso which rivalled the coffee weve had in Italy. Overall a spectacular experience and great service to boot. Will return asap!
Finally had my first truly 5 star meal in three years of eating in and around the Vancouver area. Truly the best pasta I ve ever had. Place is worth the wait and lives up to the hype

Food 5/5 Always good food. We tried family set chosen by the chef. All very tasty. Service 5/5 professional, attentive Ambiance 4/5 as always very busy and hard to get a table but guess it s good for the restaurant:) Return likelihood 5/5

Went last night to try the family style tasting menu. was so great and had such variety in every dish. rob took care of us and was super attentive to me when i mentioned our food restrictions and would personally change his food choices for us this night. each staff that approached us made us feel so welcome and warm we started with the burrata and rosemary crackers, beet salad, lamb ragu pasta (10/10), strip sirloin (10/10), whipped ricotta squash and grilled broccoli i before finishing with some sorbet and a chocolate tart. was exceptional and the service was so memorable.

It was my second time visiting, and had great experiences both times.  Ive shared a variety of dishes which were all delicious, but definitely get a pasta (or two!). The service dropped off by the end of this last meal and was quite slow, and the only knock on the atmosphere is the incredibly close spacing of the tables... it felt like we were sitting at one table with 4 strangers.
One of my all time favourite Italian restaurants. I will always crave their olive oil focaccia. Best! Great service and amazing food. Can not wait to go back!

Must try tasting menu for $75 (family style). We got so much food to split between 5 people. Flavours were outstanding and comforting. The protein dishes was the highlight. They make their steaks better than steakhouses. If you want to taste the best in Vancouver this is it.

My boyfriend and I came here for a birthday reservation, and had an amazing time! We ordered the Alla Famiglia, where the chefs surprise you with your multi-course meal experience. The server will ask about any allergies and dietary food restrictions, as well as any ingredients that you dont like. All the course items were delicious, but we especially enjoyed the prosciutto starter and our two mains of pappardelle and veal. Each prosciutto bite paired nicely with the pears, cheese and balsamic vinegar. The pappardelle had a rich ragu sauce that was spicy and slightly sour from the pickled cabbage. The veal was juicy and the accompanying bed of polenta was delicious as well. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant, and the servers were incredibly attentive and detailed with the explanation of each dish. We will definitely be coming back here in the future!

Even on a Wednesday evening, this place was packed with a line-up! Understandably, the reason is because its a great place for dinner!  We got a last-minute reso thru OpenTable, which Id recommend for anyone who hates waiting    We went with their Alla Famiglia which put the choices of what we were having in their hands. It was a ton of food and we loved it all!  There was a point when I just forgot to take any more food pictures and just enjoyed the buzz in the restaurant and the company I was keeping

We had the let us cook for you option and it was amazing. Everything tasted was better than it sounded and looked on the menu. The rainbow trout special was one of the best fish dishes I have had in my life and the other items were all amazing. The staff is super attentive and got all the details right. The amount of food was decent for us and id say good for most people. We only had dinner than night so it would have been hard to stuff us. If I had to come up with some negatives it would be that the place was a bit crowded and the drinks were pricey for what they were despite them being solid. I would recommend for special occasions.
Extremely impressed with every aspect of this restaurant. Delicious and creative flavors! I will be coming back and reccomending this place to friends and family.

Delicious as always. Buratta is always a must have for me. The fish was a miss for me, edible but on the dry side. The salad and squash were amazing. I wish the pasta had more of a chew to it but excellent nonetheless.

Very nice upscale Italian restaurant. We had the  Let us cook for you  option for two, which included 8 dishes (2 appetizers, 2 salads, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts). Every dish from beginning to end was fantastic, but the oxtail pasta and the pork chop dish were especially delicious. The staff were kind and provided good service. In addition, the restaurant features a great overall atmosphere.

Loved my experience. Delicious food and waitress was sooo fun. Had an amazing experience, great way to celebrate our anniversary. The chef s choice was the way to go! We got to try some fresh spot prawns too. Awesome night! Great wine! That lamb ragu pasta is something I ll be thinking about for awhileee.

Incredible service, fun atmosphere, good food. We got the course menu for a group of three people and upgraded our main to the strip loin. Definitely had a great experience and our server even brought out an extra salad to challenge my dislike for kale! Only criticism: Would have liked to have more dessert options given it was a group of three (had to share 1 delicious tiramisu). As full as we were, there s always room for dessert :)

Incredible experience in every sense of the word. The food was perfectly cooked and perfectly presented. Our server, I think his name was Nate, was so lovely and hilarious, and it really made the experience of the food so much better. Ive been to fancy restaurants where the service is extremely formal and professional, and I find that almost detracts from the dining experience, so Im glad the service here was more laid back. Honestly, my friend and I were comparing this place, and the whole experience, to Michelin Star restaurants weve been to in France and NYC... and this place easily competes, and perhaps even outcompetes a few of them. I read some reviews saying the portion sizes were small, but I found them to be just perfect. Between my friend and I, we ordered an antipasti, a salad, two pastas, one dessert, and two scoops of gelato, split between the two of us... and we had to take leftovers home. Suffice it to say, the portions were also perfect My two absolute favourite dishes out of the ones we tried were their antipasti Burrata, Baker Breeze  heirloom tomatoes, basil, chili oil, focaccia and their pasta Pappardelle, milk braised pork ragu, nduja, preserved cabbage, pecorino. 10/10 Recommend.

The best restaurant Ive been to in Vancouver. They specialize in pasta, but I was even impressed by a side dish of squash we ordered. Not only are the tastes excellent but the variety of textures in any one dish hits all the right beats. The only downside is that they are always at capacity and you have to book way in advance.

This will be a meal that we remember for a long time! Everything was delicious in the tasting menu and the pacing was perfect. I was worried it would be way too much food for me, but it was actually perfect. Just a bit full, not over stuffed, lol. Service was stellar, and staff all made it feel very special for my husbands birthday. Highly recommend for any occasion. I loved the sharing family style and so much of the food and drinks brought me back to Italy.

I hadnt been here in a while and now I dont remember why I waited so long!! My partner and decided to have dinner here - we left so impressed and satisfied. We chose to go with the Alla Famiglia $79 per guest option to get a good tasting and variety off of the menu. We honestly werent sure if the amount of food we were getting would be worth the value. Ultimately, our server was amazing at selecting the perfect dishes based on our responses to his questions. We had prosciutto di parma and kanpachi crudo - both starters were so flavourful and fresh. The chicory salad was unique, more on the bitter side for me that lingered a little too much, but I appreciated that the roasted pears and hazelnuts tied everything together. I was a little worried about the cappelletti because of the gorgonzola cheese but the hints of preserved lemon shone through the  filling. The NY striploin - cooked a perfect medium rare, great flavour profile - outstanding! I also enjoyed every bite of candied carrots and other veggie sides. Overall my partner and I were very impressed with our meal due to quality of ingredients, generous portions for value , and ability to accommodate the menu to our preferred tastes. Quality was worth the value? Yes, for the alla famiglia style Would I come back? Yes Would I recommend to friends and family? Yes

Absolute favourite Italian restaurant in Vancouver! The foods always amazing, the menu changes often enough to keep things exciting, and the service is always fantastic! Went most recently to celebrate a birthday, and they were very sweet about it. Props to our server as well for remembering the allergies at our table!

Beautiful interior, cozy but seating is a bit tight. Service is top notch. Food is excellent but tbh wouldn t call it amazing. Presentation is like homemade family style, and taste is 80/100. Good dining experience overall.

Excellent, on all fronts. Great atmosphere and decor, not too loud, friendly and knowledgeable staff. We dined Alla Famiglia, and our server Rob chose the most amazing dishes for us, and paired our drinks to our meal perfectly. All the food was sublime, and the birthday card was such a special touch. Can t wait to come back!

Fantastic! The food was great, the service  was spectacular and the atmosphere was  cozy yet formal. We had the 69$ five course dinner and enjoyed every bite. You get allot of food in each course and all of it was mouth watering. The service though...that was something that really stood out. Never have I had such amazing service. No empty plate sat on the table for more then 2 minute, the waiter was super attentive, without pressuring and the other wait staff were seen but not heard. It was also good to see what I can only assume to be the owner, making sure everything ran properly. This is a restaurant you must visit and will probably be rated the top Italian restaurant in 2021.

We came to Savio Volpe to celebrate our anniversary and we were not disappointed! We have never been to an Italian restaurant because hubby thinks making pasta at home is easy. This restaurant proved to us that good Italian food is worth going out for. We were greeted with glasses of Prosecco to celebrate our anniversary, which was such a pleasant surprise. We were also offered complimentary sparkling water for our table, which I loved! As for our meal, everything was delicious. Beef Carpaccio: 4/5 So delicious! I especially loved the leek aioli. My only complaint is that the plate wasn t bigger! Kale Salad: 3/5 Really tasty, but I think we could make this at home. Lamb Ragu: 5/5 This pasta dish knocked it out of the park for me. The type of pasta is not something I ve ever had before, and the texture was so cool! I loved the flavours of the meat and sauce too. So good. Pork chop: 5/5 The portion of this plate was outstanding! We were both in awe as this plate was delivered to us. There was a delicious honey sauce covering the meat and plate, and the meat was cooked perfectly. I also really enjoyed the sausage-stuffed morels.  We were pretty stuffed by the time this arrived so we took about half home as leftovers, and it s enough for a full meal for both of us. Cannoli: 5/5 This was the perfect way to end our meal. The pistachio, citrus, chocolate combination was to die for. We had never had cannolis before, but after this one, we are definitely fans! Overall, the food and service made this the perfect date night. We were very satisfied!

Very busy. Glad we reserved a table well ahead of time. We ordered Garlic knots, kids pasta with meatballs, kale salad, spaghetti Alla nerano, pork chop, German butter potatoes, chocolate tart and sorbetto. The special menu sounded fantastic but decided to go ahead with the regular menu items. Kids pasta had generous portion and the meatballs were very good. Garlic knots were devoured by my little boy. Kale salad also had a good portion and it was perfect to have with our pork chop. Spaghetti portion was bit on the small side (surprisingly) but the flavour and texture was fantastic. Porkchop was smoky, well seasoned and perfectly cooked. It was the one of the best porkchops I have tried so far. German butter potatoes were packed with flavour but ours had  a few that were a bit over-charred. Chocolate tart was decadent with pine nuts giving a perfect contrast. All in all, this was one of the most satisfying dinner Ive had recently. Definitely will go back. Kid-friendliness: Its a bit noisy and most menu items are not great for little kids. However, they do offer off the menu kids pasta. Staff are very kind and friendly to kids.

Amazing food and service.    Molto delicioso. Fresh, delicious pasta cooked perfectly. Everything we had was excellent, with balanced flavour combos. Best Italian in town, in my opinion. The family style steak you pick from raw cuts. It was cooked perfected.

Service was fantastic and the food was phenomenal. We did the let us cook for you $72 per person order. It was great because they surprised us with different dishes that were all absolutely delicious. We will be back for sure!

Overall dining experience was fabulous. We celebrated my partner s birthday there and they welcomed us with a birthday card and closed our dinner with a complimentary birthday cake, very sweet indeed. Our server, Ryan, was very attentive to our requests and provided excellent customer service. The food was  . We will surely go back. Highly recommended.

We ordered the alla famiglia and was impressed with the various dishes. We advised our server, Donby, of individual food allergies/dislikes, and he made accommodations to satisfy every diners needs. The dishes were delicious and plentiful. Donby overheard our conversation mentioning that the dinner was to celebrate our friends birthday, and surprised him with a scoop of gelato topped with a candle to cap off the meal.  Truly professional service without being intrusive from Donby and the rest of the restaurant team. Well done! Thank you for making the evening enjoyable and memorable!
One of my favourite restaurants. Probably the best Italian restaurant in Vancouver. The service and food is always awesome.
I can t stop raving about this place. Every single dish - appetizer, main course, dessert, drinks - was outstanding! The price tag is well worth it for the amazing fine dinning experience!

Can be somewhat hard to get a reservation but a definitely a worthwhile visit. Great food, atmosphere and service. Dishes were unique and both looked and tasted amazing. We enjoyed everything we tried   both times we were here and am already looking forward to the next time we are back again.

Best Italian dish I ever had. each dish has lots of flavor from fresh ingredients. It was pretty much enough for share as Huge amount ever dish. Plating was awesome. I was really enjoying dinner with my friend Thank you very much for all your service

It was my first visit to this restaurant that Ive heard much about. We came here to celebrate a friends birthday and were very lucky to be able to get an earlier reservation. The octopus   carpaccio and the prosciutto were really good, paired well with the recommended wine. I was hesitant to try the bagna cauda because I dont like the fishy taste, but the bagna cauda was really flavorful. It was one of my favorite dishes of the night. Kale salade was fresh with just enough dressing.  The mains did not wow me much, but maybe we need to go back and try other dishes. The chicken was juicy and is well seasoned. We had gelato for dessert, the olive oil flavor was  interesting in a good way.  It was a wonderful dinner and we would come back again. Would recommend this place for couples night out, celebrations, or if you just need to treat yourself to a nice meal. Parking: Street parking

What a delight! I have driven by occasionally and from the outside it is understated, a little coffee-shop looking.  Inside a cavern,  in the best senses of that term.  Open, airy, beautiful decor. My only nit to pick was the volume. Very loud. The cocktails and food - hard to find the words for such perfect, creative choices.  Watermelon and goat cheese salad.  Just wow. The pasta perfectly done - like from Nonas hands.  The pork belly a melt in your mouth enchantment. I know the menu changes but I cant imagine this place making any mis-steps. Booked my next dinner the next morning.

We dined here on a Sunday evening and it was packed! A reservation is a must (1 month). The food was delicious and we re good portion wise. Our servers Paula and Preston we re very tentative and friendly! Minor downside is that there isn t a lot of space between tables.

I went to Savio for my birthday Monday night and it was absolutely incredible. The service was top notch - our drinks were never empty and made exactly how we wanted them. Everything we ate was fantastic. I will dream about the agnolotti for the rest of my life. And they even brought me a birthday dessert with a candle. Thank you for a memorable birthday dinner.

Absolutely amazing. We had the tasting menu family style, and it was worth every penny. Every course was perfectly made and delicious, and the service was so welcoming and attentive. This is a new top fave in Vancouver for me, and I cant wait to go back.

We ordered the  alla famiglia  set menu and jt was such a fun experience! I enjoyed trying things I would not have ordered otherwise. The service was great. There was a gentleman who appeared to be the manager checking in at each table to make sure everything was good which was a nice touch. The price point is high at almost $200 for two people after taxes and gratuities, so I would save coming here for special occasions.

We ordered the alla familia (which is a tasting menu, that you can customize to your liking) and almost every dish was spectacular. My fiance has a severe allergy to peanuts and all tree nuts and they were able to accommodate fantastically. The server was really nice, and kept our glasses topped up. I came for my birthday and it came with a gelato at the end. Marinated Olives 1/5 Definitely my least favourite dish of the night. The olives definitely tasted better than any other olives that Ive had before but it was just too overwhelmingly salty for my palette Burrata (imported from Italy), coronation grape mostarda, frescolio oil with housemade crackers 5/5 Words cannot describe what I felt when I took that first bite of burrata, mostarda and cracker. It was perfect. The richness of the cheese paired so perfectly with the tartness of the mostarda and the crunchy crackers gave it the texture it needed. It was just ... Chefs kisses Kale Salad 5/5 Absolutely amazing. The bread crumb sprinkled on top of it was nice and crunchy even until the last bite. The tartness of lemon pepper dressing prepared us for the main course. Agnolotti Dal Plin 5/5 There were so many different flavours. You first taste the amazing sauce and then the agnolotti explodes with the amazing meat filling. Northern Golden NY Striploin 4/5 Cooked to a perfect medium rare. The beef was juicy and packed full of flavours. German Butter Potato 4/5 Flavour was amazing. It was just a bit too starchy for my liking. Broccolini Aglio e Olio 4/5 Nothing too special. It was just a good broccolini. A bit too greasy near the bottom, but I guess thats how aglio e olios are supposed to be. Tiramisu 5/5 Really good tiramisu. Not too sweet, and the lady fingers were nice and moist. Dietary restrictions: Accommodated for tree nuts and peanut allergy

This restaurant is trully one of a kind. I highly recommend the family feast option. Come hungry, open minded and leave with a full heart and belly. Though getting in can be tricky, once we were settled in Staff were very courteous and service was timely. Would love to come back and try some different foods.

Where do I start.  Fantastic restaurant.  Food was exceptional.  Our waiter Preston truly was one of the best waiters I have ever had.  We had the 5 course meal and we left the food decision to him.  Preston asked us a few questions about our food allergies (I do have a few) as well if we had any foods that we don t like.  Everything he picked for us was excellent.  We will definitely go back.

Excellent service, top notch food and ambiance. We had a reservation here for hubs birthday dinner and left the place tummy full, good conversations, and leftovers(big portions). The team left a lovely birthday card with their signature kale salad recipe. It was a thoughtful gesture, thank you. Also gelato on the house. We tried their garlic knots, kale salad, lamb Ragu and rigatoni pasta s.  None of them disappointed. Brandy cherry gelato was amazing too. We will be back.

Amazing restaurant and service. We did the family style option and let our server, Rob, take us on a full on dining experience! He did an awesome job building our menu for us and every dish was superb. Highly recommend over and over again! Thanks, Rob!

Osteria Savio Volpe is always busy, make sure you have reservations before hand. The wait is well worth it! The ambience seems crowded but not overly loud, definitely one of those places where you can not only enjoy your meal but also engage in active conversation. Burrata & Mortadella, pistachio salsa verde Burrata was super fresh, the salsa verde added the much needed texture to the dish The focaccia was served warm Rating 5/5 Agnolotti dal plin, chicken and pork Perfectly balanced and flavorful Rating 5/5 Acquerello risotto The risotto was perfectly seasoned and was probably fine on its own, however the hazelnuts and truffle add another layer of complexity to the dish Rating 5/5 Spaghetti, duck ragu Larger portion than the others we sampled, but the taste was on point. Rating 5/5 Their gelatos are worth sampling too, we tried a couple - roasted strawberry and tiramisu. Neither disappointed.

First time here a few weeks back and I can now appreciate why it was so difficult to get a reservation (youll definitely want to make a reservation, by the way). The food was delicious. They have a broad selection of various dishes, so, to simplify my life, I opted for their tasting menu, which I felt gave me a great cross-section of whats offered. The menu started with a high-quality antipasti, topped with a delicious cheese and aged balsamic. The salad they brought was so interesting, made primarily of apples, avonlea cheddar, and topped with a delicate citrus dressing. The highlight was definitely the pasta dish, made with burata and rabbit, was incredibly rich and delicious. This alone convinced me I would want to sample more of their pasta dishes next time I come back, although the 63 acres striploin that followed the pasta was also exceptionally well made. I did mark down their service, as the most recent time I went, there were wait times aplenty. I was seated 20 minutes past my reservation time, and the wait times for food were atrocious - very disappointing. I would still recommend this place based on the food alone, but their service is in need of some help if my most recent visit is any indication.

Wow. 10/10 experience. Food, service, ambiance, vibes, everything! In Preston we trust. Preston was a phenomenal server and gave us the most amazing experience and culinary adventure. The three of us dined alla famiglia at $75 each for appetizers, two pastas, an entree and dessert. We loved being able to try as many things as possible and Preston asked us what we liked and didn t like to curate the dishes and experiences. Every bite was amazing. For starters, we had the halibut croquettes. It was on special tonight and it was nice and crispy with a great aioli. Served next was the charcuterie board with an assortment of meats, grapes and plums. The star for me was the salad - wow. The dressing was stunning. Pastas were perfectly cooked. The spaghetti was so tasty and reminded us of an elevated carbonara of sorts. The other pasta whose name I forget but looked like/named after a rooster head was equally stunning. The entree - the feature specials - butterflied grilled fish, served with grilled zucchini and this eggplant stew. The fish was so soft but not over cooked and served over corn and beans. The eggplant stew was tasty but a tad oily. The star was the zucchini. Just grilled perfectly with a nice mint twist. A restaurant that makes vegetables taste good is truly a keeper. Dessert - we shared the feature gelato which was unreal - it tasted like a terry s orange. I would ve bought a whole gallon of it. The chocolate tart was also amazing - perfect dark chocolate, not too sweet with sea salt and pine nuts on top. I personally could have gone workout the olive oil. We also had a ton of great cocktails and wines recommended by Preston. Ended off the night with a digestivo - which is meant to be sipped and not taken like a shot! Preston recommended me a drink with an orange undertone to match the gelato, but my friends also really enjoyed the no. 82 amaretto and limoncello. Stunning meal, 10/10!

Wow this place did not disappoint! I came here without a reservation last Friday and they were able to get us in outside on the front patio. The 5 of us did the tasting menu/chefs choice. Each course had a few different dishes and the group got to share family style. The food was absolutely top notch and literally did not stop coming. I am pescatarian and they did a fantastic job accommodating for me while still offering some meat dishes to the rest of the group. The I cannot wait to go back and experience this culinary perfection. Cocktails were also delicious and pretty good wine list! Only con is being on the front patio, traffic is pretty loud on Kingsway, so I would suggest making a reservation for indoors.
